definition: ritual money made of paper burnt for the Gods or the dead
paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: And he dropped it on the ground and started to grind it into the floor with his shoe.
sentences.chinese: 他把錢丟到地上，並用鞋子把紙錢踩進地裏。

sentences.english: He threw the paper money in the fire.
Along with the ash of a handful of paper offerings.
sentences.chinese: 同着一手把的紙錢的灰。

sentences.english: When the burn sticks and paper's money, they believe joss can bless my family.
sentences.chinese: 當燒香和紙錢時，他們相信佛祖會保佑我們家。

sentences.english: Zu sent when the paper money burned a lot of financial offerings in order to "enjoy their ancestors."
sentences.chinese: 送祖時，紙錢冥財燒得很多，以便“祖先享用”。

sentences.english: His friends and family burnt incense and Chinese money for the afterlife.
sentences.chinese: 他的朋友和野人爲他的去世燒香和焚燒紙錢。

sentences.english: Yan Wang is normally depicted wearing a Chinese judge's cap and sometimes appears on Chinese Hell Bank Notes.
sentences.chinese: 閻王通常戴着一頂烏紗帽，紙錢上也會有他的形象。

definition: to burn paper offerings (as part of religious ceremony)
to offer flowers/to lay flowers (as a memorial)
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
billowing smoke (idiom)/foul atmosphere/(fig.) murky atmosphere/in a turmoil
poison gas/toxic gas/manifestation of passion, anger etc (Buddhism)
